general: This law allows the government to spend money from the Consolidated Fund to pay for things like salaries, pensions, debt interest, and other expenses during the financial years 2005-2006 and 2006-2007. It also says how much money can be spent each year. This helps ensure that the government has enough money to provide important services to the public.

series.text:
* Simplified point 1: The Consolidated Fund Act 2005 authorizes the use of up to £3,183,848,000 for the service of the year ending with 31st March 2006.
* Simplified point 2: The Consolidated Fund Act 2005 also authorizes the issue of up to £4,677,710,000 from the Consolidated Fund of the United Kingdom for the same period.
* Simplified point 3: For the year ending with 31st March 2007, the Act authorizes the use of up to £171,791,003,000 for the service, and the issue of up to £161,256,893,000 from the Consolidated Fund.
* Simplified point 4: The Act gives the short title "Consolidated Fund Act 2005".

summary: The Consolidated Fund Act 2005 allows the government to spend up to £3 billion in the financial year ending March 31st, 2006, and up to £4.7 billion from the Consolidated Fund of the United Kingdom during that time. This money will go towards various government services such as healthcare, education, defense, etc. Additionally, the act sets aside £171 billion for the following financial year (ending March 31st, 2007) and allows the government to borrow up to £161 billion from the Consolidated Fund. In simpler terms, this law lets the government spend and borrow money to fund its activities and services.
single:
* Authorizes the use of £3,183,848,000 for the service of the year ending with 31st March 2006.
* Authorizes the issue of £4,677,710,000 from the Consolidated Fund for the year ending with 31st March 2006.
* Authorizes the use of £171,791,003,000 for the service of the year ending with 31st March 2007.
* Authorizes the issue of £161,256,893,000 from the Consolidated Fund for the year ending with 31st March 2007.
* Short title: Consolidated Fund Act 2005.
This bill authorizes the use of funds for the years ending with 31st March 2006 and 31st March 2007. It authorizes the Treasury to issue funds from the Consolidated Fund for these years. The total amount of funds authorized for the two years is £6,861,556,893.
